sources.title: West Point (1927)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. An egotistical football player at a military academy must learn to be more humble after accidentally injuring his friend. He also meets a girl that makes him reconsider his actions. This picture stars Joan Crawford and William Haines, who were both solid box office draws at the time.Â

metadata.Plot: Wealthy Brice Wayne enters West Point and, though he does well on the football field, angers fellow cadets with his arrogance. Disciplined by the coach he yells "To hell with the Corps!" which would have led to further discipline but for the intervention of his hero-worshipping roommate "Tex." He resigns anyway, but just before the big game returns to lead his team and reunite with Betty Channing, the hotel owner's daughter.
metadata.Actors: William Haines, Joan Crawford, William Bakewell
